alert.note: Alert for Bland; Grayson; Smyth; Tazewell; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 1:51PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Bland, Grayson, Smyth, Tazewell and Wythe. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across southwestern Virginia with rainfall rates as high as three quarters of an inch per hour in spots. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beech Fork, Bluestone River, Big Horse Creek, Blue Spring Creek, Big Creek, Big Reed Island Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Bear Branch and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wytheville... Galax... Bland... Marion... Richlands... Bluefield... Tazewell... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
